title: Gamification-Based Microlearning for Algorithm Skill Development

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Learners access 10-minute modules (5 sessions per week) via personal mobile devices and engage in motivation-driven problem-solving activities through gamification elements

learning_goals: Learners can solve basic algorithm design problems by applying the four-stage Pólya problem-solving model (Understanding the Problem-Planning-Execution-Reviewing).
Learners sequentially progress through three gamified levels (beginner-intermediate-advanced) to enhance their algorithmic complexity analysis skills.
Learners algorithmically model real-world industry problems in team projects and implement executable pseudocode with at least 85% success rates.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
